@graph.caption: two mini cake sugar skulls decorated for dia de muertos

@graph.name: Easy Sugar Skull Cakes « Dora's Table
@graph.description: These mini sugar skull cakes are the perfect activity to do with the kids to celebrate Dia de Muertos. They are so fun to make!!

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Easy Sugar Skull Cakes
@graph.description: These mini sugar skull cakes are the perfect activity to do with the kids to celebrate Dia de Muertos. They are easy to make and super fun to decorate.
recipeIngredient: 1 box Duncan Hines Moist Red Velvet Cake Mix

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease cake pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease cake pan.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl combine the chickpea flour and 6 tbsp. of water and mix well. Place the Duncan Hines cake mix in a large bowl and add the chickpea flour mixture, vegetable oil, and water. Mix well with a whisk until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl combine the chickpea flour and 6 tbsp. of water and mix well. Place the Duncan Hines cake mix in a large bowl and add the chickpea flour mixture, vegetable oil, and water. Mix well with a whisk until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour cake batter into cake pan and bake for 20 to 25 min. or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove cake from over and let cool for 5 minutes in pan. Invert cake pan onto a rack and let cakes full off completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour cake batter into cake pan and bake for 20 to 25 min. or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove cake from over and let cool for 5 minutes in pan. Invert cake pan onto a rack and let cakes full off completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll your fondant into 6 small balls about 3 inched wide. Sprinkle your counter with cornstarch and roll out fondant until ¼ inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll your fondant into 6 small balls about 3 inched wide. Sprinkle your counter with cornstarch and roll out fondant until ¼ inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread a thin layer of icing on the skull cakes and place fondant on top. Use your fingers to smooth out the fondant and fill the crevices of the skull. Tuck the fondant under the cake. Repeat this process with the rest if the cakes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread a thin layer of icing on the skull cakes and place fondant on top. Use your fingers to smooth out the fondant and fill the crevices of the skull. Tuck the fondant under the cake. Repeat this process with the rest if the cakes.

recipeInstructions.text: Place 1/8 tsp. of your favorite gel food coloring in small bowls dilute with about 1 -2 tsp. of water.
recipeInstructions.name: Place 1/8 tsp. of your favorite gel food coloring in small bowls dilute with about 1 -2 tsp. of water.

recipeInstructions.text: Now comes the best part!! Paint your skulls with a paintbrush and the gel food coloring or with icing writing pens. Let icing paint dry then eat.
recipeInstructions.name: Now comes the best part!! Paint your skulls with a paintbrush and the gel food coloring or with icing writing pens. Let icing paint dry then eat.

@graph.keywords: day of the dead, dia de muertos, skull cakes
